page.title: 15LEITH MUSEUM
page.content: Since the early 1900s there has been a Leith collection of antiquities. Apartfrom displays lasting a few days, they were last on show in Starbank House. Many items are still stored in Huntly House. However, on 17th June 1985, an exhibition about Leith as it was up to 1920 opened at the Custom House. It is hoped that attendances will be high and lead to Leith having a permanent museum in the future. {LEITH FESTIVAL:MID-JUNE } Local folk enjoyed Leith Games as long ago as 1840 and the Pageant from just after World War 1. Later came the Festival which, for most people begins with the{GALA DAY}held on Leith Links. During the following week many exhibitions, competitions, sporting events and cultural activities take place at venues within the community.
